page.title: 02 Ecology
page.content: The area affords great variety. In the East there are gentle lightly wooded hills,interspersed with fields with mature hedgerows. The valley floor of the Conwy is covered with fields, often inundated in wet weather,and used for grazing or silage. Hilly country comprises the western area and includes part of the valleys of the Crafnant and Geirionydd rivers. It is sheltered by the mountains to the West and North. This is excellent walking country with pleasant woodlands and rough pasture divided by dry stone walling and mature hedgerows. Opportunities for orienteering, rambling and climbing abound, and outdoor pursuit centres cater for adventure experience for children from the inner cities. The average rainfall is high.
